definitions.definition: to try to end a situation between two or more people or groups who disagree by talking to them and trying to find things that everyone can agree on
definitions.sensetop: mediate (in something)mediate between A and Bmediate something

examples.text: The Secretary-General was asked to mediate in the dispute.
An independent body was brought in to mediate between staff and management.
Wilson tried to mediate between the European powers to end the war.

definitions.definition: to succeed in finding a solution to a problem between people or groups who disagree

examples.text: The UN attempted to mediate a solution to the conflict.

definitions.definition: to influence something and/or make it possible for it to happen

examples.text: Educational success is mediated by economic factors.

wordOrigin: late Middle English (as an adjective in the sense ‘interposed’): from late Latin mediatus ‘placed in the middle’, past participle of the verb mediare, from Latin medius ‘middle’.
